subject: Creativity
title: The Subscription Model: How Creativity Became Recurring Revenue
description: A 60-second lesson on The Subscription Model: How Creativity Became Recurring Revenue.

hook.text: Photoshop used to cost $999 once. Now it's $20.99/month forever. Adobe's revenue tripled.

buildup.text: The subscription model (SaaS) converts one-time purchases into recurring payments.

discovery.text: It transformed music (Spotify), publishing (Substack), education (MasterClass), and software (Creative Cloud).

twist.text: Critics argue subscriptions mean you never own anything. Stop paying, lose access.

climax.text: For creators, subscriptions provide stability: $10/month from 1,000 fans is $120,000/year â€” reliable income that.

punchline.text: Creativity used to sell products. Now it sells relationships.

quiz.question: How did Adobe's revenue change after switching to subscriptions?
